result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • Gerald E. Fox was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Credit given for any administrative suspension.
Complete an AODA and follow through with driver safety plan.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.

Attend the O.W.I. Victim Impact Panel on January 8, 2015.
Complete the AODA and follow througjh with driver safety plan.
Reimbursement for Blood Test Costs to the City of Medford Police Department.

timeConds.notes:
Corrected Judgment of Conviction:  Jail term begins no later than 01-17-2015 at 4:30 pm.

Conditional jail term shall begin no later than 01-71-2015 at 4:30 pm.  Good time is granted.

The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.

Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Gerald E. Fox in court with attorney Harold C. Wolfgram.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waiver of preliminary hearing filed.  Waived freely, voluntarily, and intelligently.  Based on waiver court bound DE over for trial.  Information filed with further reading waived and matter proceeded to plea and sentencing.  Agreement placed on the record.  DE entered a plea of no contest to Ct. 1.  Plea colloquy.  Court found plea given freely, voluntarily, and intelligently; accepted plea; found DE guilty.  Pursuant to the agreement Ct. 2 is dismissed; Ct. 3 dismissed and read in.  Tracking citations 14TR632; 14TR633; and 14TR634 are dismissed and read in as well.  Court withheld sentence and placed DE on probation for three years with the following conditions:  $2135.00 fine with court costs and DNA surcharge inclusive; 100 days county jail with Huber to start no later than 01-17-2015 at 4:30 pm; 27 month DL revocation with credit give for any administrative suspension; AODA and complete driver safety plan; pay $41.00 blood draw reimbursement; IID for one year effective upon licensure; attend the OWI VIP panel.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 17, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

Defendant Gerald E. Fox in court with attorney Harold C. Wolfgram.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waive reading of complaint.  Waive time limits for a preliminary hearing.  Plea of not guilty to the traffic matters.    Bond Continued.    Defendant may leave the State of Wisconsin as ordered in Case No. 14CF39 in September between the dates of September 11, 2014 through September 15, 2014.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 1, 2014 at 10:30 am.  - rt

*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure.  Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol.  Defenant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.

Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant appeared in court in custody. Court found probable cause for the arrest. Court advised DE of possible charges and penalties. Court advised DE of right to attorney.  Notice of right to attorney given to defendant.  State requested a $2000    signature bond with conditions of:   Comply with booking; not possess or consume alcohol and not drive a motor vehice without a valid driver's license.  Court ordered bond with conditions as requested.  Court ordered clerk to begin bond revocation proceedings in case 14CF39. Initial appearance set for    at      a.m./p.m.
